name: Mediterranean Empanadas
author: jackieh
ingredients: 1 ½  skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into strips
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Combine chicken strips, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, 1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper in a bowl
Meanwhile, combine tomato and onion with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, and 1/4 teaspoon balsamic vinegar
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Cook chicken in a hot skillet until juices run clear, 5 to 8 minutes
Use 2 forks to shred the chicken in the skillet
Add lemon juice to finish cooking
Roll each section into a 6-inch circle on a floured surface, working fresh basil into the dough as you roll
Layer spinach, chicken, mozzarella, and tomato mixture on one half of each circle
Fold over to cover the filling and press the curved edge to seal
Lightly coat a baking sheet with olive oil
Lightly brush the tops of the empanadas with olive oil and transfer to the baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes
